list_definition.definition: a bath (for washing in); bath British

list_ex_of_english: Lexically, experts sometimes used quite idiosyncratic terms, such as bathtub.
Next scene, she is shown in a bathtub singing the song to herself.
The system is to be installed under bathtubs, and the installation should be carried out without any changes to the current bath design.
The game pieces consist of a deck of 110 pipe cards, 1 bathtub-shaped card tray, and 10 small metal wrenches.
Each bathtub contained 5.5 m3 of water.
If a man buys a bathtub and installs it in his house, he has to meet a considerable additional cost for installation.
The assessment of the district scientists was that the subsoil was watertight, while the local authority scientists maintained that the subsoil was as watertight as a bathtub without a plug!
This should also be incorporated with at least one bathtub or shower for every ten students.
